sn41.10:1: Now on that occasion Citta the householder was sick, afflicted, gravely ill. Then a number of park devatas, grove devatas, tree devatas, and devatas dwelling in medicinal herbs and forest giants assembled and said to Citta the householder: "Make a wish, householder, thus: ‘May I become a wheel-turning monarch in the future!’"
sn41.10:2: When this was said, Citta the householder said to those devatas: "That too is impermanent; that too is unstable; one must abandon that too and pass on."
